fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A column made reference to an initial decision that “only 15% of NHS staff could be tested” for Covid-19; in fact it was 15% of daily testing capacity that was limited to NHS staff (We will judge our leaders soon. That should frighten them, 4 April, Journal, page 1). • Dua Lipa’s debut single was New Love, not Hotter Than Hell as we said in an interview with the singer (Rules of distraction, 3 April, G2, page 4). • Other recently amended articles include: How the Covid-19 crisis locked Airbnb out of its own homes North Atlantic’s capacity to absorb CO2 overestimated, study suggests Kathleen Kennedy Townsend mourns relatives lost in canoe accident Why isn’t the government publishing more data about coronavirus deaths? Who will lead us through these troubled times?
